sect4.title: Overview

row.entry: This module is used to crop, rotate and correct perspective distortions of your image. You can overlay your image with various helpful guidelines that assist you using the tools.

sect4.para: Some of the tools of this module, namely adjustment of angle and corrections of perspective distortion, will require the original image data to be interpolated. For best sharpness results set lanczos3 as pixel interpolator in core options (see ).

sect4.title: Usage
sect4.para: Whenever the user interface of this module is in focus, you will see the full uncropped image overlaid with handles and guiding lines.

First off, select what aspect ratio you want and size the crop boundaries by dragging border and corner handles. Use the button right of the aspect box, to swap between portrait and landscape mode. You can move around the crop rectangle by holding down left mouse button and move around. When you are done and want to execute the crop, just give focus to another module or double-click into the image base. You can at any time change your crop area by just revisiting this module.

sect5.title: flip
sect5.para: This tool is used to flip the image on the horizontal,vertical or both axis.

sect5.title: angle
sect5.para: This tool corrects the rotation angle helping you level an image. You can either set a numerical value or use your mouse directly on the image. To use your mouse, right-click, hold it down and draw a line along a suited horizontal or vertical feature; as soon as you release the mouse button the image is rotated so the line you drew matches the horizontal/vertical axis.

sect5.title: keystone
sect5.para: This tool is used to correct perspective distortions in your image. Useful for example when you shoot a high building from ground with a short focal length, aiming upwards with your camera. The combobox lets you select the type of correction you want to use :

row.entry: if you want to limit the correction to vertical lines
limit the correction to horizontal lines
if you want to correct horizontal and vertical lines

entry.para: Depending on the selected correction type you will see two or four straight adjustment lines overlaid to your image. Two red circles on every line let you modify the line positions with your mouse. Each line additionally carries a symmetry button. If activated (and highlighted in red) all movements of the affected line will be mirrored by the opposite line.

In order to correct perspective distortions, you need to find suitable horizontal and/or vertical features in your image and align the adjustment lines with them. When done, press the OK button, which is located close to the center of your image. The image will be corrected immediately. You can at any time come back and refine your corrections by selecting correction applied in combobox keystone.

sect5.title: automatic cropping
sect5.para: Use this options to avoid black edges on the image borders. Useful when you rotate the image.

sect5.title: aspect
sect5.para: Here you can change what aspect ratio you want to have on the result, thus constraining the proportion of width and height of the crop rectangle to the aspect ratio of your choice. Many common numerical ratios are pre-defined. A few special aspect ratios deserve explanation:

row.entry: free forming the rectangle without any ratio restrictions
this option constrains the ratio to be equal to image ratio
this option constrains the ratio to be equal the golden number
this option constrains the ratio to be 1

sect5.para: You can also select any other ratio after opening the combobox and typing it in the form of x:y. If you want a certain aspect ratio to be added to the pre-defined ones you can do so by including a line of the form
into darktable's configuration file $HOME/.config/darktable/darktablerc. Here foo defines the name of the new aspect ratio and x and y the corresponding numerical values.

sect5.title: guides
sect5.para: Many self-explaining guides are available to help you compose your image.

sect5.title: guides flip
sect5.para: In case the chosen guidelines are not symmetrical relative to the image frame, you can flip them on the horizontal,vertical or both axis.
